word.item: The girl was very beautiful, it is said.
Now Kingfisher would turn into a person and court her at night, it is said.
Now he courted her (until) he married her, it is said.
Then taking her (with him) he went home, it is said.
When they got to his home in the night, it was dark, it is said.
Where she thought she had climbed upstairs, it turned out, when she arose the next day, (that) they were living on the limb of a hackberry (tree), it is said.
Now she got up early and said, it is said, (that) she was hungry.
Then Kingfisher caught some minnows on the water and came back and gave (them) to her, it is said.
After that she became ashamed, it is said.
She sang and danced, it is said.
she was saying to him, it is said
She spoke to him, it is said.
She was saying to him, it is said
"If you stay on the water, I, when I get up into the sky, shall remain (there)," she told him, it is said.
Now radiating (light) all about (her), she went up into the sky, it is said.
She became the Sun, it is said.
Now she lights up the whole world, it is said.
So the Indians now dance the Sun (Dance), it is said.
Kingfisher, (however), continues to dwell on the water, it is said.
Kingfisher, however, continues to dwell on the water.
